This is one of my favorite games of all time. It's my favorite in the Half-Life series, and also just generally a great game. I'd recommend playing both Half-Life 2, and Half-Life 2: Episode One before this however, just to understand the storyline a bit more.

It's much better than HL2:Ep1 and possibly even better than HL2 itself. So if you were a bit disheartened with Ep1, don't let it discourage you from trying this timeless classic!

Pretty good game. You are a garden gnome, being taken to a ship with your escorts Gordan Freeman and Alyx Vance. Only 4.4% of the time you actually make it. The other times you aren't even noticed or you die. What a shame. When you do make it however, you get sent off, blown up and forgotten about.

We need a sequel to find out if we survived the explosion or not. It is important. Thanks for understanding Valve.
Top notch sequel to a top notch series! Fantastic science fiction story rich FPS action with puzzles. Waiting for the 3rd installment...

A series so good, it's a shame it's been left in this spot for the last 10 years. Episodic development suits a specific type of game and a specific type of studio. Valve learned that the hard way and as a result, the fans have had to suffer for it. Let us hope an experiment like that will never be repeated. Let's also hope the people who genuinely care about Half Life aren't all dead before Half Life 3 ships.
450 million people have died since 2007, who will ever see the conclusion of this saga..How many more Gabe? How many more have to die before Half Life 3 is finished?

Half life 2 Episode 2 is a masterpiece among games.

I've nominated this game for The "Game that Deserves a Sequel" Award because I can't think of any other game that deserves one more than this.

The half life community is one of the best communities out there, the fact that they've stuck with this series for over 10 years now is insane and it's only getting bigger as the days go on.  The modding community is still active and thriving, and the game is still in the minds of those that played it so long ago.

I'm fairly new to the series only playing it on the orange box in 2011 on the xbox 360 but I've bought all the games again on steam and replayed each of the games several times just because I can't get the same kind of experience in any other game that half life gives me. 

It's not your everyday first person shooter, you're free to do as you like on every map in the game without having to wait through cutscenes you don't care about.  What few cutscenes there are in the series feel special and they're genuinely interesting and short, straight to the point.  The developers wanted to take the control away from the player as little as possible, they wanted you to be immersed in the atmosphere and the characters; which some developers don't seem to care about anymore.  

I don't feel I shouldn't really go into too much in this review since if you're buying this game you've probably already played the other games and it's been around for 9 years now so there are already plenty of other reviews that can describe how beautiful this game is much better than I can.
10/10 game, really amazing. Can't wait for the sequel in 2217!

Jogo incrivelmente completo, com uma bela historia, bela jogabilidade e gráficos exelentes para a época!

Half-Life 2 and it's two sequels represent the true pinnacle of FPS. The polygamous marriage of atmosphere, graphics, narrative and music, with gameplay being the head honcho of the whole harem, causes this game to rocket to the top of all my lists and retain it's place in my heart year after year (over a decade now, actually).

Perfection. Actual perfection in video game form.

Half Life Episode Two is just great: great gameplay, story (which is continuation from HL2 and EP1) and writing, soundtrack and the graphics still look good today.

The game took me about 7-8 hours to complete on my first playthrough. You should definetely pick up the series from a Steam sale as they get very cheap.

Half Life is one of my favorite game series ever, and it's sad that it ended on a cliffhanger for many years. We need closure!

This game is an amazing game, I'd reccomend it to anyone looking for a nice time waster,
